abstract: The final 2008 deal league tables are in, and the two major data providers were split over which bank ranked No. 1 — JPMorgan Chase or Goldman Sachs — but agreed that Morgan Stanley tumbled in the rankings.
snippet: The final 2008 deal league tables are in, and the two major data providers were split over which bank ranked No. 1 — JPMorgan Chase or Goldman Sachs — but agreed that Morgan Stanley tumbled in the rankings.
lead_paragraph: The final 2008 deal league tables are in, and according to Dealogic, JPMorgan Chase was No. 1, ending Goldman Sachs‘ years-long reign at the top of the deal-making heap.

headline.main: League Tables Shake Up Wall Street Order
